# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Here is a function that wraps text to a specified line width:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    line = ""
    lines = String[]
    
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = ""
        end
        
        if isempty(line)
            line = word
        else
            line = line * " " * word
        end
    end
    
    push!(lines, line)
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

It splits the input text into words, then iterates through the words, appending them to a line string. When the line length exceeds `text_width`, it starts a new line. The lines are collected in an array and joined with newline characters at the end.

Here is an example usage:

```julia
text = "This is some text that will be wrapped to demonstrate the wrap_string function."

print(wrap_string(text))
```
